author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/libsvn_subr/utf.c
(svn_utf_cstring_from_utf8_ex): Was svn_utf_cstring_ftom_utf8_ex. (Huh?)

author: sussman
msg: Fix issue #1523:  'rm file; svn up' now resets entry-timestamp correctly.
Also, this adds another use-case for possibly setting 'commit-time'
timestamps for upcoming issue #1445.
* libsvn_wc.h (svn_wc_crawl_revisions):  take new 'use_commit_times' boolean.
* libsvn_wc/adm_crawler.c (restore_file): take new 'use_commit_times'
arg.  after copying text-base to working file, possibly set working
timestamp to commit-time.  And unconditionally set the entry's
timestamp to match the working file.
(report_revisions, svn_wc_crawl_revisions):  update callers of
restore_file(), pass new 'use_commit_times' argument into it.
* libsvn_client/diff.c (diff_repos_wc):  update caller of
svn_wc_crawl_revisions().
* libsvn_client/status.c (svn_client_status):  same.
* libsvn_client/switch.c (svn_client_switch):  same.
* libsvn_client/update.c (svn_client__update_internal): same.

author: kfogel
msg: * notes/contrib-committer.tmpl: Template for emails to offer new
commit access in the contrib/ area.  Mike Pilato suggested just
keeping this in the tree, which seems convenient to me too.
If someone wants to check in an analogous 'full-commit.tmpl' or
something, go for it.  However, it's likely that adding contrib
committers will be more frequent than adding other kinds.

author: kfogel
msg: * IDEAS: Removed.  Having this file on the top level is just a
distraction; the 'users' and 'dev' lists are better places to
discuss new ideas.  Meanwhile, if anyone feels that some of the
information here should be saved, just retrieve it from the
previous revision and file Post-1.0 issues.

author: xsteve
msg: * New command: svn-status-toggle-elide on $
- elide files or directories
* svn-status-bury-buffer
- Improved the bury algorithm - send all psvn buffers to the end of the buffer list
* Some cosmetic changes in status messages
